channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Bupa’s CEO Iñaki Ereño woke a sleeping giant—and set a 100,000 strong workforce running toward digital health
item.description: How Bupa’s CEO balances triathlons, technology and the transformation of global health.

item.title: Mattel Debuts New Hot Wheels Racing Game Exclusive To BMW’s AirConsole
item.description: Now you can race hot wheels cars while you're sitting in your car but not driving your car, if you really like cars.

item.title: Ben & Jerry’s co-founder says Unilever 'stopped' ice cream company from creating a 'flavor for Palestine'
item.description: Ben & Jerry's co-founder Ben Cohen said he is creating his own Palestinian-themed ice cream after Unilever allegedly "stopped" the company from making...

item.title: Voice AI Startup Mappa Reinvents How Teams Hire
item.description: Mappa uses voice AI to analyze speech patterns and predict team fit, redefining how companies hire with behavioral intelligence.

item.title: Saudi Arabia is now a nation of city-dwellers, and ‘cities don’t lie,’ says urban development leader
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Update Now As Microsoft Confirms New Windows Admin Protection
item.description: Microsoft adds new protections for Windows users to prevent malicious applications and actors from attacking your account. Here’s what you need to kno...

item.title: When To Turn Clocks Back This Weekend As Daylight Saving Time Ends
item.description: Daylight Saving Time ends in North America on Sunday, Nov. 2, at 2 a.m. Here’s when to “fall back” and what really changes.

item.title: Everyone thinks AI is replacing factory workers, but Amazon’s layoffs show it’s coming for middle management first
item.description: As Amazon slashes 14,000 white-collar roles and the U.S. approaches a million job cuts this year, AI’s first major labor casualty might be emerging.

item.title: The Hollywood blueprint holds the key to reshaping organizations in the age of AI
item.description: The Hollywood model of work is a refreshing alternative to the rigid structures of the industrial era.

item.title: Real estate CEO says the luxury industry is all about one thing: a ‘return on ego’
item.description: DarGlobal CEO Ziad El Chaar sees co-branded real estate—what he calls the “limited edition of real estate”—as both a cultural anchor and a magnet for ...

item.title: Samsung Finally Unveils Galaxy TriFold And Confirms Release Date
item.description: The three-screen Samsung Galaxy folder has now been unveiled in South Korea. Here’s what was revealed.

item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's term ends in May 2026, but that isn't stopping Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent from moving ahead with finding h...

item.title: Social Security COLA for 2026 revealed following shutdown-related delay
item.description: The Social Security Administration revealed its annual cost-of-living adjustment (COLA) for 2026, which is going to boost benefits by 2.8% next year t...

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
